The gleeful jabs were reserved for BJP’s Manoj Tiwari — “Hope he doesn’t suffer a heart attack” — and Tajinder Bagga — “He will not be able to show his face, he is so full of hate”.

Sanjay Singh said Amit Shah put in his muscle, money and scorn into the campaign, but “the results were on the work done”.

Not ceding an inch, he reiterated to the crowd, “Your son was called a terrorist. Now Delhi’s family of 2 crore has shown the country that her son is a ‘kattar deshbhakt’. It was said it would be a Hindustan vs Pakistan match, so Hindustan has squarely won.”

Everyone had their own ideas about Kejriwal’s priorities going into the third term. But what about Shaheen Bagh? “It can be resolved in a day. Take back the law. At least the Union government must speak to the protesters. Baat toh karo,” said Kohli.

“Elections are over, let us see now. I can speak for Seelampur. We will now see what steps to take to address the protesters’ issues,” said Shahbuddin Ansari of Vidhan Sabha 65.

“The fight is on.”

Title: Vijay climbs atop van, takes selfie with fans
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Cuddalore: Film actor Vijay, who is nursing political ambitions, concluded his part of shooting for his upcoming film titled, 'Master' on NLC India Limited premises on Monday.

The actor seemed to be in a jubilant mood after witnessing his fans' spontaneous reaction to a protest by a less than a dozen BJP cadres condemning the NLCIL company for granting permission for the shooting of his film on its premises.

On the day of protest on Friday close to 100 fans gathered at the gate of mines 2 of the company but on Monday when he visited the mines to continue the shoot hundreds of his fans gathered to have a glimpse of their silver screen hero.

Vijay seemed to be elated on seeing the support of his fans and climbed atop his van and took a selfie in his mobile phone with his fans on the background and posted it on his twitter account with a message thanking Neyveli.

On Friday, the CISF personnel used mild force to disperse his fans when they attempted to scale the gates of the Mines 2 of the company in an effort to see their matinee idol.

Title: P Parameswaran cremated with full state honours
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Alappuzha: RSS ideologue P Parameswaran (93) was cremated as senior BJP leaders, besides family, Muhamma villagers, friends and admirers bid him a tearful adieu. Thousands of mourners gathered at his ancestral home, Thamarasseril Illam at Kayippuram in Muhamma, where he was cremated with full state honours.

Parameswaran’s funeral pyre was lit by his brother’s grandchildren Pratheesh T U and Prasanth T U on Monday.

His body was taken from Thiruvananthapuram at 3pm. The ambulance carrying his body stopped in front of K P Memorial Upper Primary School, Muhamma, where he completed his primary education. Students and teachers of the school paid floral tribute to him.

The ambulance’s final destination was near Kochanakulangara Devi temple, Kayippuram, from where the body was taken home in a mourning procession joined by thousands of people.

The body was placed on the premises of the Illam for the public to pay their last respects. People from all walks of life paid tributes.

BJP leader and former Madhya Pradesh chief minister Shivaraj Singh Chouhan, Union minister of state for external affairs and parliamentary affairs V Muraleedharan, and BJP leaders K Surendran, P K Krishnadas, M T Ramesh, Kummanam Rajasekharan, Shobha Surendran and others paid their respects.

After paying homage, Chouhan said that Parameswaran dedicated his life for Sangh Parivar organizations. “He has stamped his own mark on all the fields like poetry, literature, politics and writing. He was a great role model for others,” Chouhan said.

Manju Unnikrishnan, daughter-in-law of Parameswaran’s brother, is currently residing in the ancestral home.

Title: Coronavirus in Goa: Goa following WHO norms on coronavirus
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Vishwajit Rane

PANAJI: The state has a vigil mechanism in place to track and monitor people coming to Goa from China, health minister Vishwajit Rane, said.

To a question if a separate place for isolation, rather than a ward in a hospital, would have been safer, Rane replied that the state was following WHO guidelines as well directions issued by the Union ministry of health and family welfare.

A ward each in Goa Medical College and hospital, Bambolim and Cottage Hospital at Chicalim, have been earmarked to quarantine and treat suspected cases of nCoV.

The state has 23 persons under observation. Dr Utkarsh Betodkar, state epidemiologist, said a male patient is being treated for pneumonia; his samples have tested negative for nCoV.

Besides the Mormugao port, medical staff have been posted at the Goa international airport to record passengers’ temperatures.

Title: Thousands pay homage to RSS ideologue P Parameswaran
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan pays his last respects to RSS ideologue P Parameswaran in Thiruvananthapuram o... Read More

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Thousands of people from different walks of life paid homage to departed RSS ideologue P Parameswaran on Monday. Those who paid their last tribute include governor Arif Mohammad Khan , chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan , Mizoram governor P S Sreedharan Pillai, Union ministers D V Sadananda Gowda and V Muraleedharan and state ministers Thomas Isaac, E Chandrasekharan, Kadannappally Surendran and Kadakampally Surendran, senior BJP leaders O Rajagopal and Kummanam Rajasekharan.

RSS sarva karyavah Bhayyaji Joshi reached Samskrithi Bhavan, headquarters of Bharatheeya Vichara Kendram, on early Monday morning and paid tributes to the departed leader. He recalled Parameswaran as a son of mother India who dedicated his entire life for serving her. Other senior leaders of state RSS and BJP were also present.

The mortal remains were taken to Samskrithi Bhavan from Kochi on late Sunday night. In the morning, body was taken to Ayyankali Hall and kept their for public to pay homage till 10.30am. TNN

Title: Black & white era songs brighten up musical evening
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

NAGPUR: Music lovers went down memory lane with their weekend a mellifluous one while enjoying the black & white era songs from 1930s to 1960s ‘Gujra hua kal yaad rahega har pal’, on Sunday. One of the standout features of the show was singers wearing black and white attires matching the theme.

Staged at Scientific Society Hall, Laxmi Nagar, the programme featured evergreen Hindi and Marathi songs presented by artistes of Survandita group. They brought back memories of songs originally sung Ashok Kumar , Devika Rani, KL Saigal, Geeta Dutt, Uma Devi, Talat Mehmood and Shamshad Begum. The show was conceptualized by Uma Raghuraman and Hemant Darvekar.

The programme started on a devotional note with the song ‘Dehachi tijori’ from Marathi movie ‘Amhi Jato Amchya Gava’. It was followed by a duet performance of Raghuraman and Gopal Iyer on the song ‘Mein ban ki chidiya’.

Iyer stayed back to present a beautiful rendition as he adapted to the intricate notes of the song ‘Ek bangla bane’.

‘Jab dil hi tut gaya’ by Darvekar won him accolades. Bhagyashree Kulkarni not only sung but also tapped her feet to the tunes of ‘Latpat latpat’. Nupur Godbole lent her melodious voice to ‘Tera jana dil ke armano’.

The audience responded with a thunderous applause to ‘Akhiya bhool gayi hain sona’, ‘Chhod do anchal’, ‘Dil par hua aisa jaadu’, ‘Dum dum diga diga’, ‘Dil par hua aisa jaadu’ and ‘Mala baiko milali’ among others.

The panel of singers included Ashutosh Chahande, Raju Tandale, Bhagyashree Badwaik, Vilas Dandge and Nandu Andhare. The anchor Vijay Jathe kept the spectators captivated with facts about famous singers.

The singers were accompanied by Pawan Manwatkar (keyboard), Prakash Chauhan (guitar), Prashant Nagmote (tabla), Mahendra Watulkar (octopad), Nitin Janware (congo and dholak) and Manna Dawn (bass guitar).

Title: Corpn awaits govt nod to widen Sathy Road, Nallampalayam Road
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Coimbatore: The city corporation is gearing up to widen Sathy Road in north zone to reduce traffic congestion. The plan is to widen the road from Velan theatre to Ganapthy bus stop for about 300 metres.

A source with the city corporation said they had submitted a proposal to the state government to widen the road at a cost of Rs 7.18 crore and sought fund under the infrastructure an amenities fund. “We are waiting for the approval.”

The source said the project would require land acquisition. “We need to acquire 10ft land each on both sides of the road. Upon widening the road, which sees heavy traffic movement, traffic congestion would come down to a larger extent.”

The city corporation has also made a proposal to the government to widen Nallampalayam Road that connects Mettupalayam Road and Sathy Road for about 5.2km at a cost of Rs 27.88 crore.

Pointing out that the plan was to widen the road anywhere between 50ft and 80ft, the source said the project wouldn’t be possible without acquiring land, which would cost around Rs 4.24 crore.

The move is expected to reduce traffic congestion on 100ft Road and Thudiyalur-Saravanampatti stretch in the city as a lot of commuters would use Nallampalayam Road.

The proposal to widen Nallampalayam Road was first made in 2014 and a year later a landowner had donated the city corporation 13 cents land along the road for the project. But the project has not taken off till date.

Title: Information directorate releases annual report
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Puducherry: The Directorate of information and publicity for the first time released an annual report for the years 2017-18 and 2018-19 outlining its activities in the two financial years. Chief minister V Narayanasamy released the two reports in the presence of secretary (information & publicity) K Mahesh, director (information & publicity) M M Vinayaraj and assistant director (information and publicity) E Kumar at his chamber in the legislative assembly on Monday.

Title: Police moot Virtual Q system to regulate Sabarimala pilgrims
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: In view of effectively managing the increasing influx of devotees to Sabarimala temple every pilgrim season, the state police have mooted utilizing the Virtual Q system of the police to regulate the movement of pilgrims to Sannidhanam.

The idea was mooted at a high-level meeting of police officers convened at police headquarters on Monday to review the performance of the police in the pilgrim season that just concluded.

One of the main concerns that came up in the meeting was the increasing number of pilgrims every year, making crowd management a difficult task for the police. It was suggested that if all pilgrims used the Virtual Q system to book darshans, then the police would know the number of pilgrims that might turn up at Sannidhanam each day and thereby make necessary arrangements to ensure their smooth movement. Presently police are often forced to restrict pilgrims at Pamba to prevent Sannidhanam becoming overcrowded, which in turn might lead to a stampede.

It was decided in the meeting to put forward this suggestion before the state government for their consideration.

State police chief Loknath Behera, in a statement released here, said if the government approved the suggestion, the upgraded Virtual Q system could be made functional by March 15. A five-member team of top officers led by Thiruvananthapuram city police commissioner had also been formed to visit all the south Indian states and sensitize the authorities about the new system.

Title: Tribal MPs from state meet Prime Minister
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Gandhinagar: Four BJP members of Parliament (MPs) met Prime Minister Narendra Modi and handed over a written representation, demanding removal of three communities from the list of communities included in scheduled tribes (ST) in Gujarat.

MPs Jasvantsinh Bhabhor, Prabhu Vasava, Geeta Rathva and Mansukh Vasava met the PM and requested him to direct the state government to remove the Rabari, Charan and Bharwad communities from the list of STs. The MPs contended that members of these communities are not tribals.

The representation by the MPs could cause further worry for the Vijay Rupani government, which is facing the heat because of protests being held by different communities over the reservation policy of the government in its Lok Rakshak Dal recruitment process.

Speaking to reporters, the MPs claimed that a few families of the Rabari, Charan and Bharwad communities living in the Gir, Barda and Alech forest areas were originally granted ST status. However, in 1972, the Baxi commission included these communities within the OBC quota. The MPs contended that even while enjoying reservation under the OBC quota, members of these communities are seeking benefits under the ST quota as well.

Title: Candolim health centre to get ‘int’l facilities’
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Calangute: The medical facilities at government health centres and hospitals in Goa are the best amongst all states, said chief minister Pramod Sawant.

Talking at a ceremony held to lay the foundation stone of the Candolim primary health centre’s (PHC) new wing on Monday, Sawant said that Goa was the only state where government hospitals provide free facilities and medicines, and even specialised treatments like angiography and angioplasty.

Sawant, who is an Ayurveda doctor, recalled that he had spent a year practising ayurveda at the Candolim PHC around 15 years ago.

“Once the new building is ready, it will become a community health centre, with emergency treatment facilities,” health minister Vishwajit Rane said, adding, “It will be a showpiece PHC with international quality facilities,” Rane added.

Calangute MLA Michael Lobo said the state government has sanctioned Rs 20 crore for the new wing of the PHC. “When Manohar Parrikar was chief minister, he had sanctioned Rs 10 crore and now Pramod Sawant has sanctioned another Rs 10 crore. It has been our dream to have a modern medical facility in Calangute-Candolim, and now that dream is coming true,” he said, saying that the existing PHC was built 48 years ago, when Shashikala Kakodkar was CM.

The new wing is being constructed by the Goa State Infrastructure Development Corporation.

Title: ‘CM should clarify when law on protected agri zone will be passed’
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Coimbatore: A day after chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami announced the Cauvery delta as a ‘protected agriculture zone’ and said the state would not give its nod for hydrocarbon projects there, CPI state secretary R Mutharasan on Monday asked the CM to clarify whether the state would enact a law in this direction.

“The Centre has already given permission to Vedanta and ONGC to extract hydrocarbon from the region. The CM should clarify whether these permissions would be revoked,” said Mutharasan, who was speaking to reporters in the city. Terming that the announcement was long due, he said the state should enact a law in this regard in the assembly session that begins on February 14.

Speaking of IT searches, he alleged that the income tax department was acting as a wing of BJP and accused the party for using I-T to intimidate its adversaries. “In the recent searches on the premises belonging to film financier G N Anbu Chezhiyan and others, Rs 77 crore cash and documents were seized. There have been talks that this money belongs to prominent politicians. The I-T department should unearth whose money it was and should identify them,” he said.

On the TNPSC scam, he said it has rocked the state and has undermined the faith of the public, parents and students on the commission. “Around 14 people have been arrested in connection with the scam. They are all low-level employees. There should be a thorough inquiry as to who were the high-level people who were involved in the scam. We seek a CBI probe under the supervision of the Supreme Court.”

He said the state police were not giving nod to conduct demonstrations against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), but were asking us to conduct meetings nevertheless. Later, after we conduct the meeting, they file a case against us, he alleged.

Title: BS-IV two-wheeler inventories clog city showrooms
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Ahmedabad: With the Union government remaining firm on phasing out sales of BS-IV vehicles from April 1, two-wheeler dealers across the city are jittery over clearing inventory of BS-IV compliant vehicles. Estimates by dealers suggest that inventory worth Rs 100-120 crore of BS-IV-compliant two-wheelers has piled up in Ahmedabad alone. This amounts to a stock of vehicles that lasts up to a month and a half.

“Despite discounts, sales have remained muted, owing to the impact of slowdown. Customer footfalls are also significantly low at showrooms and discounts as high as Rs 10,000 on vehicles priced around Rs 65,000 are not proving enough to convince customers into buying. The demand is still good for popular models but for others, it continues to remain low-key,” said Rajesh Patel, a city-based two-wheeler dealer.

Federation of Automobile Dealers’ Association (FADA) had also made a representation to the Union government, urging to defer the date for stopping sale of BS-IV-compliant vehicles. However, since the decision was taken by the Supreme Court, the government denied the request.

With barely a month and a half to complete phasing out of sale of BS-IV compliant vehicles, dealers are not just concerned over clearing pending inventory but are also struggling to get finance. “Dealers keep the vehicle inventory on finance because not all have deeper pockets. However, Non-Banking Finance Companies (NBFCs) have tightened norms and as a result, dealers are not getting funding for BS-IV-compliant vehicles,” said Pranav Shah, director, FADA – Gujarat.

Vehicle sales have overall remained muted in Gujarat due to the slowdown. According to data furnished by the Union ministry of transport, 1.10 lakh vehicles were registered in January 2020 in Gujarat, declining by 14.18% against December 2019, when 1.2 lakh vehicles were registered in the state. In fact, vehicle registrations showed a consistent de-growth for three months in a row since November 2019.

Title: Broadest possible unity need of the hour: Basu
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Kozhikode: CPM politburo member Nilotpal Basu said that the most important factor in the ongoing battle to protect the Constitution of the country is to forge the broadest possible unity between various sections of people, irrespective of ideological differences.

Speaking after inaugurating the golden jubilee celebration of the Calicut University employees union at the varsity campus at Tenhipalam on Monday, he said that all sections of people, castes, communities, identities and genders cannot be brought together in the fight to uphold the legacy of the country without forging such a broad unity.

“What we need the most today is unity. Our ideologies, we will defend to our last breath. But beyond ideology there are sections of people with whom we have our differences, with whom we have had very bitter battles in the past. But unless we salvage India and the Indian Constitution, what remains?” he said.

He said that the unified fight against the policies that are undermining education and employment will create a common platform for the larger struggle for the defence of the Constitution.

“Modi want to take us to a new India. But in the struggles that we are witnessing, another new India is born and that is the hope for the future,” he added.

He said that the country was going through a critical juncture as right-wing forces and the central government were trying to divide people and to systematically weaken and politicize all institutions, including higher education sector, election commission and the armed forces.

CPM leader P Rajeev, syndicate member K K Haneefa, general secretary of All India University Employees Confederation M B Sajjan among others spoke.

Title: High court upholds legality of VACB
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Kochi: The high court has upheld the legality of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau (VACB) as a wing of police empowered to investigate and prosecute offenders in corruption cases.

A division bench of Justice A Hariprasad and Justice N Anil Kumar considered two petitions by K Karunanidhi of Edava and K T Mohanan of Idukki, challenging their prosecution by Vigilance on corruption charges.

Only a police officer not below the rank of a DSP can investigate corruption cases as per Section 17 of Prevention of Corruption Act. The petitioners argued that the police officers deputed to Vigilance department ceases to be ‘police’. The government had set up an anti-corruption machinery named ‘X-Branch Police’ through a government order in 1960 (Ext.P3). In 1964, home department issued an order constituting a separate department named ‘Vigilance Department’, separated ‘X-Branch Police’ from police department, and placed it under the administrative control of a director. In 1997, ‘Vigilance Department’ was renamed as ‘Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau’. As police personnel were deputed to VACB, they cease to be part of ‘police’, the petitioners argued.

Senior public prosecutor Suman Chakravarthy argued on behalf of the government that VACB is nothing but a unit or branch of the police force. Police officers working in VACB remained to be police officers and the challenge against the 1964 order (Ext.P4) is devoid of any factual or legal basis, he contended.

In the judgment, the HC held, “On a thorough consideration of the pleadings, records placed before us and arguments advanced, we are of the view that various challenges raised against Ext.P4 in these cases are legally unsustainable…. Intent and purport of Ext.P4... is only to streamline the working of X-Branch created as per Ext.P3…. We have no hesitation to hold that the source of power for issuing Ext.P4 can be traced to the Police Act, 1960.”

The judgment further said, “…VACB is only a continuation of X-Branch… Later, it was transformed into vigilance department… Police officers working in VACB cannot be said to be officiating after their powers are denuded. Petitioners’ contention that VACB is only a government department formed for conducting a preliminary investigation and after completing such preliminary investigation the case ought to be handed over to the DSP functioning in the law and order stream cannot be accepted.”

Finally, the court said, “... we hold that the Police Act, 1960, which itself was enacted in accordance with the authority under List II in the 7th Schedule to the Constitution of India, confers power on the State Government to issue Ext.P4. Contentions raised by the petitioners, that the registration of crimes, conduct of investigations, arrest of accused persons, filing of final reports and prosecution of cases in accordance with Ext.P4 are illegal, cannot be sustained...”

Title: Maharashtra: Green cess up to Rs 10 likely on every bottle of IMFL, country liquor, beer
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

The state is looking to make an additional Rs 1,000 crore in 2020-21

MUMBAI: A government official said on Monday that the state was likely to levy up to Rs 10 green cess on each of the 350 crore bottles of IMFL and country liquor and 125 crore bottles of beer sold annually in the state to generate additional revenue. “Instead of enhancing the excise duty, it was proposed to levy green cess per bottle. Exact quantum of green cess will be decided later, but it will be up to Rs 10 per bottle,” the official said.

On lowering excise duty on premium brands of imported liquor, the official said that excise duty in the state is the highest in the country. The official said the imbalance encourages large-scale smuggling of imported liquor from neighbouring states, leading to loss of revenue.

“We found that for a bottle of premium brand of imported liquor, Maharashtra was levying an excise duty ranging between Rs 2,000 and Rs 3,000, whereas in most states it was below Rs 1,000. We have proposed rationalisation of the duty structure on imported liquors. We expect that we will continue to garner the same amount of excise duty owing to more consumption of liquor,” the official said.

The official said excise on premium brands of imported liquor is much lower in Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu and New Delhi. “It was always believed that Maharashtra is charging the highest excise duty on imported liquor. We will reduce it suitably, so that our revenue mobilisation is not affected adversely,” the official said.

The official said that compared to Uttar Pradesh and Tamil Nadu, the state target for excise duty is much lower owing to it having fewer shops. In UP, the number of country liquor shops is 14,000 and the excise duty target is Rs 29,000 crore.

In TN, the target is Rs 31,000 crore. In Andhra and Telangana, the target is Rs 38,000 crore. “In Maharashtra, there are 4,000 country liquor shops and 1,400 IMFL shops. We have not given new licences after 1974. We have imposed total ban on liquor in three districts — Wardha, Chandrapur and Gadchiroli,” the official said

Title: Kunhikrishnan appointed HC judge
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Kochi: The President on Monday appointed advocate P V Kunhikrishnan as a judge of the Kerala high court. Swearing-in ceremony is expected to be on Thursday.

A notification regarding the appointment as an additional judge for two years was issued by ministry of law and justice on Monday afternoon. Judges are appointed as additional judges initially and are then appointed as permanent judges later on.

The Supreme Court collegium’s recommendation for appointing high court lawyer Kunhikrishnan as a judge was originally issued in October 2018. In February last year, the collegium led by CJI Ranjan Gogoi had reiterated its recommendation for appointing Kunhikrishnan as a judge of the Kerala HC after the central government objected to its initial proposal.

After completing schooling at Payyannur, Kunhikrishnan graduated in law from Kerala Law Academy at Thiruvananthapuram. He had enrolled as an advocate on December 17, 1989. Practising at Kozhikode district and sessions court and other subordinate courts from January 1990, he shifted practice to the high court in October 1993. TNN

Title: Gargi college 'molestation' case: Shameful, say Kejriwal & Sisodia; Congress, BJP slam incident too
Content:
Manish Sisodia and Arvind Kejriwal

गार्गी कॉलेज में हमारी बेटियों के साथ बद्सलूकी बेहद दुखद और निराशाजनक है। इसे क़तई बर्दाश्त नहीं किया जा सकता। दोषि… https://t.co/k0XKYQ70Nw — Arvind Kejriwal (@ArvindKejriwal) 1581321247000

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday termed the Gargi College incident “extremely sad and disappointing” and sought stringent punishment for the accused. Students of the all-women college were allegedly molested by a group of middle-aged men who entered the college by breaching the security and groped the students and also harassed them at cultural festival on February 6. The incident was reported after some students narrated their ordeal on social media.“The misbehaviour with our daughters at Gargi College is extremely sad and disappointing. It cannot be tolerated at all. The culprits should be caught and given stringent punishment. It should be ensured that the children studying in our colleges are safe,” Kejriwal stated on Twitter.AAP functionary Manish Sisodia said the incident was disgusting. “Such fests are opportunities to celebrate the cultural diversity and talent in Delhi. But the obvious anti-social elements saw this fest as another chance to inflict harassment and violence on students!,” Sisodia stated on Twitter.AAP MP Sanjay Singh deplored the incident and said it is shameful that such an incident took place in the capital. He attacked the BJP over the incident and questioned the police. The students have alleged that cops were deployed close to the college gate but did nothing to check the anti-social elements.Delhi BJP and Congress also condemned the incident and demanded that the culprits be arrested at the earliest. Delhi BJP president Manoj Tiwari said the college administration should immediately provide CCTV camera footage of the campus to the police. Delhi Congress president Subhash Chopra slammed the police and the government for “failing” to protect women.

Title: In 2019-20, five vessels seized for illegal fishing
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Panaji: A total of five fishing boats from neighbouring states were impounded in the financial year 2019-20 for illegally fishing in Goa’s territorial waters and the exclusive economic zone.

The exclusive economic zone comes under the jurisdiction of the government of India.

With LED fishing banned in Karnataka and Maharashtra, trawlers from these states are coming into Goan waters to fish, ports minister Michael Lobo had said in November 2019. As a result, the state government was in the process of notifying rules to impose stringent fines on bull trawling and LED fishing.

Currently, the fisheries department conducts routine sea patrolling up to 12 nautical miles along the Mandovi-Zuari coast to curb illegal fishing and showcause notices are issued to owners of fishing vessels caught.

The authorised officer appointed under Section 3 of the Goa Daman and Diu Marine Fishing Regulation Act, 1980, impounds vessels caught fishing in the territorial waters of the state under Section 18 and Section 19 of the act.

If the state’s fishermen are caught carrying out LED fishing the, their fisheries subsidies are withheld and fishing licences suspended for a duration depending on the gravity of the offence.

In 2017, officials from the department were deputed to inspect fishing vessels twice a week at the Cutbona jetty to check if they were using LED lights, fish light attractors or any other light equipment.

Title: Final notices to unrecognized schools within March: Officials
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Coimbatore: The school education department would issue the third and final show-cause notices within March to unrecognized schools in the district, officials said.

Last year, the department had said there were 205 unrecognized play schools and 40 unrecognized nursery and primary schools in the district.

Following this, block education officers visited the schools, took notice of the violations, and had issued first show-cause notices to these schools.

“As there was no reply for first show-cause notices, the department had issued notices for the second time. If there is no reply to these notices as well, the department would send a final show cause notice before March. If there is no reply and if the schools don’t comply, the schools would be sealed through the district administration,” a school education official said.

Following the show-cause notices, of all the unrecognized play schools, only around 10% had submitted documents for approval, the official said. Documents such as building plan approval and land documents among others must be submitted for the approval.

“Of those play schools which submitted the documents, only a few had proper documents. In some cases, even if they complied to all norms in their infrastructure, they did not show proper documents,” the official said. “Several of these play schools are run in rented residential buildings. They don’t have proper safety facilities such as safety exits,” the official added.

Last year, the directorate of school education had directed chief educational offices to crack the whip on unrecognized schools. It had asked CEOs to identify such schools, make their status public by putting up public notices and shut the schools with the aid of the district collector.

Title: Schoolteachers to be trained in handling disabled student
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Coimbatore: Around 1,900 teachers in the district, who teach Class IX to XII in government high and higher secondary schools, will be trained to handle differently abled students. The training sessions, which are conducted by Samagra Shiksha under the Inclusive Education of the Disabled at Secondary Stage (IEDSS) scheme, will be held from Wednesday to Friday in four educational districts in Coimbatore.

Officials said subject teachers along with special educators who exclusively handle differently abled students will be trained in the programme. “They will be made to understand the psychology of differently abled students, how to teach them and how to make them mingle with their classmates,” said a Samagra Shiksha official.

With the most of the differently abled students in the secondary level are in Class IX and X, the training will mainly focus on teachers from those classes, the official said.

Under the IEDSS scheme, differently abled students were brought to mainstream classrooms from special centres. “There are 659 differently abled students from Class IX to XII in government high and higher secondary schools in the district. We would train teachers to be sensitive and to understand their issues. We held such training sessions previous years too,” the official said.

The teachers will be trained on handling children with various kinds of disabilities such as visual disability, hearing impairment, orthopedic disability and psychological disabilities. Special educators who handle differently abled children would be the resource persons for the training sessions, which would be held in three batches.

Earlier this year, 221 disabled students were given aid equipment such as hearing aids, walkers, multi-sensory inclusive educational (MSIED) kits and cerebral palsy chairs, through a subsidy from Artificial Limbs Manufacturing Corporation of India (Alimco). They will also receive exemptions and aid in board exams such as scribes, extra time and exemption from language papers, depending on their ability.

Title: Hate speech case: Court grants bail to Kafeel Khan
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Representative Image

AGRA: Paediatrician Dr Kafeel Khan , who was accused of making an inflammatory speech at Aligarh Muslim University (AMU), was granted bail by an Aligarh court on Monday. Chief judicial magistrate Karuna Singh granted relief to Khan on a bail bond of Rs 60,000. Two surety bonds of Rs 60,000 each would also be furnished by the guarantors.

Khan’s lawyer Mohammad Irfan Gazi told TOI, “The court was told that Khan was falsely implicated by police under political pressure. After hearing the arguments, the court granted him bail.” Khan will be released on Tuesday as his papers are under process, he said.

The suspended doctor was arrested by UP police’s special task force (STF) from Mumbai on January 29, when he reached the city to attend a protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. He was arrested in connection with a case registered against him in Aligarh under section 153-A (promoting enmity between different groups on ground of religion) of IPC at Civil Lines police station on December 13. The case was filed after his speech at Aligarh Muslim University (AMU).

Khan was remanded to judicial custody for 14 days in Aligarh on January 31 and was later transferred from Aligarh to Mathura jail.

According to the FIR, while addressing students, without naming anyone, Dr Kafeel said that ‘Mota Bhai’ is teaching everyone to become Hindu or Muslim but not a human being. “This is a fight for our existence. We have to fight,” said Kafeel as per the FIR.

He said through CAA , the government “has shown that India is not our country”.

The FIR also states that Dr Kafeel made an attempt to vitiate the peaceful atmosphere and disturb the communal harmony with his speech.

Dr Kafeel was in the news in 2017 when he figured as one of the nine accused in a case involving deaths of several children due to alleged disruption in supply of oxygen at the BRD Medical College in Gorakhpur .

Title: Ranjan Gogoi: Trust judges on CAA, says former CJI
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Ahmedabad: Former Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi said on Monday that people must trust judges. He was speaking at Gujarat National Law University ( GNLU ) as part of ‘We, The People’ lecture series. “The matter [CAA] is pending before the Supreme Court. Trust your judges. They will decide according to the Constitution,” he said.

Justice Gogoi said that everyone might have a view on the CAA and have the right to express it. “Protests have been held, viewpoints have been expressed. Enough,” he said. “You can’t have two parallel forums,” he said, referring to the issue pending at the Supreme Court.

This was Justice Gogoi’s first public lecture after he retired from the Supreme Court in November 2019. “I thank Gujarat for giving me freedom — the first smell of freedom of speech,” he said. “Judges don’t have the freedom of speech.”

Justice Gogoi also referred to students in his home state who called off protests after sundown to prevent any violence. He said that this constructive role played by the students helped improve the law and order situation ‘overnight’. “Perhaps the most important fundamental duty is to the respect the unity and integrity of the country,” he said. Assam was the first state where protests broke out after the CAA was passed by the Parliament in December last year.

In his lecture on ‘Rebuilding the Judiciary: Nation Building’, Gogoi said that many don’t want to become judges today. “Good people are backing out, saying sorry sir, we don’t want to get into this,” he said. “Look at our appointments system — the day a name is recommended, 100 letters are sent against him, alleging from A to Z. He doesn’t get appointed. He doesn’t become a judge and his professional and personal lives are shattered.” He appealed to the law students to address the problem.

Justice Gogoi also praised the role of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and said that if Patel had been around for 10 years after India’s independence, the country would have been different. He later called for rebuilding the judiciary, ‘the way Sardar Patel built the nation.’

Title: Centre wants report on MP’s missing Swachh toilets
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Bhopal: A day after TOI reported that 4.5 lakh Swachh toilets across Madhya Pradesh have gone missing, the Union government sought a report from the state government.

Sources told TOI that the Centre has sought a reply from Swachh Bharat Mission in Madhya Pradesh on the report. Confirming it, state programme officer of Swachh Bharat Mission (rural), Anurag Verma said, “We have informed (the Centre) that 4.51 lakh toilets were found to be missing in the primary survey we carried out. We ourselves found the discrepancy. An exhaustive second verification by district-level officials is going on. Actual figures will be available then.”

Several political leaders of the state also raised the issue on social media. State Congress chief spokesperson Shobha Oza hit out at the erstwhile BJP government (the irregularities took place between 2012 and 2018), saying: “Apart from Vyapam, dumper, illegal mining, Simhastha, e-tendering, mid-day meal and other scams, Rs 540 crore worth Swachh scam also happened in which 4.5 lakh toilets went missing with the connivance of government and officials.”

Calling the tenure of former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan as ‘andhkar yug (dark age) of scams’, Oza said a preliminary probe pegs the scam at Rs 540 crore, and a detailed probe will unearth more.

Minister Jaivardhan Singh said, “Respectable Prime Minister, you could also make Shivraj Singh Chouhan the brand ambassador of Swachhta Abhiyan”. Former MP Arun Yadav wrote, “When I was state Congress president, I had raised the issue of scam in toilet construction. Now, I demand that the chief minister order a detailed probe and take action against the accused.”

Another senior Congress leader, former minister Sajjan Singh Verma, said, “As many as 4.5 lakh toilets worth Rs 540 crore have gone missing. Shivraj Singh Chouhan should say who did this and under whose patronage.”

State Congress shared it on its Twitter handle and took a dig at Chouhan, urging him to “sometimes tweet on his own actions”.

On February 1, TOI reported that 4.5 lakh Swachh loos have vanished in Madhya Pradesh, along with the Rs 540 crore it took to build them. Pictures of the toilets, taken as proof of money spend, were geo-tagged but the scamsters found a way to dodge technology. Officials who have investigated it believe the photos of toilets were taken within 6 metres of the site where the loos were supposed to be built. In most cases, pictures were taken in front of neighbours’ toilets, officials say.

It’s a reminder of the toilet door scam unearthed in Guna district in 2017, where the iron doors of 42,000 toilets were built 10kg lighter, leading to siphoning of crores.

Title: Social background report against four minors in cyber case
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Kottayam: In a rare incident, police have sent a social background report against four minor students, including three girls, in a cyber-related case to juvenile justice board.

The report was prepared after their classmate, a girl, gave a statement against them to the police. Police said the students had gone for a study tour recently and the complainant girl had lost her mobile phone during the trip. The girl who grew anxious over this suspected that the phone was in the custody of the other four students.

Fearing that the other students will misuse the photos in her phone and circulate morphed photos of her along with another boy, the girl later attempted suicide. She is recovering in a hospital now. When police recorded her statement at the hospital, she named the four students, based on which the police prepared the social background report against them.

Meanwhile, her lost phone was found from the school and the principal handed over it to police on Monday. Cyber cell will examine the phone and further probe will be based on the cyber cell report, said police. Police said that no case was charged against them as they are minors. TNN

Title: Thousands of acres of black gram crop damaged in rains
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Vijayawada: Untimely rains have pulled the rug from under the feet of farmers across Krishna district.

Scattered rains from Sunday morning have particularly affected farmers cultivating black gram and paddy this Rabi season. The weather across the district changed all of a sudden on Saturday night. Black gram grown across thousands of acres in Kankipadu, Gudivada, Vuyyuru and Machilipatnam were ruined in the rains.

“Black gram is one of the main crops in Krishna district after the completion of Kharif season. It needs very less water. We have noticed good flowering and hoped a good yield this year, but unseasonal rains are worrying. The rain will increase chances of viral infections and pests,” said K Rama Narayana a farmer from Komatigunta Lakulu.

Untimely rains have damaged flowering of mango crop in Nuzivid. “It is the third consecutive year that rains have affected mango farmers. Crops damaged during the flowering stage will affect the quality of fruit,” said K Narasanna, a farmer from Edhara village.

Benz Circle, Patamata, Gundala, Ramavarappadu areas received scattered rain on Monday evening. Devotees attending Gunadala Mary Matha festival were inconvenienced. Day temperatures have come down to 28 degrees Celsius and relative humidity levels touched 78 percent on Monday. Potholes on the city roads were filled with rainwater and a few drains overflowed. Sanitation workers swung into action and desilted the drains at problematic locations. The mosquito menace has increased in colonies adjacent to irrigation canals across the city. Authorities of Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) said they are making special arrangements to repair roads damaged by untimely rains.

Officials were using advanced technology to repair potholes.

Title: Alone, they fight the stigma too
Content: Kochi: A village panchayat in Palakkad called an emergency meeting in the name of a person who was quarantined at home to discuss the issue of coronavirus and precautions that need to be taken.In another incident, the health department lodged a complaint with cyber cell after they learned that someone had shared the photo and details of a quarantined person, his friends and close relatives on social network and demanded that all of them should be quarantined. Meanwhile, a medical student who had returned from China and put in home quarantine complained that her parents, who ran a shop, were unable to open the shop as neighbours objected to it.Despite only three confirmed cases of coronavirus in Kerala and state government’s best effort to control the spread of the globally-hit disease, there seems to be an underlying prejudice against those who are quarantined.Data from health department’s mental health rapid response team that was set up on February 3 to deal with issues faced by those who are quarantined at home and in isolation ward points towards this. Of the 2,600 people contacted till Sunday evening, around 200 complained of some sort of mental concern, with majority — 77 persons — complaining of some or the other form of stigma that they or family members faced after being quarantined.Incidentally, these experiences are not just limited to families and individuals. “Recently, we received a call from a child on our helpline who complained that his classmates were teasing him as his father had visited China in the recent past. They asked others to stay away from him, calling him coronavirus,” said a health official.To check this, the health department has taken proactive steps to sensitize people by creating awareness about the infection. “Due to our robust district mental health programme, we have been able to connect with people and provide them support. If we learn any quarantined person is facing any kind of stigma, we immediately ensure that the community is made aware of the service the person is doing to the society by strictly agreeing to be home quarantined,” said Dr Kiran P S, who is heading the mental health rapid response team.If the stigma is limited to a specific area, then the health officer from that area is informed about the same to conduct sensitisation and awareness programme, with a message to support those who have agreed to go for home quarantine. Till Sunday evening, the 215-member team had reached out to 2,600 persons.“While the major concern for those home quarantined was social stigma, those admitted to the isolation ward had anxiety issues and loneliness,” added Dr Kiran. Their main worry was whether they would test positive and once tested negative, their concern was whether they would be infected by another person admitted in the isolation ward or a health provider who interacts with an affected patient.

Title: Discrepancy in UIDs of 2.5L students
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: With the second-round cross-checking of UID details of students in government , aided and unaided schools getting over, unique IDs of more than 2.5 lakh students have been rendered either fake or unavailable.

State government ventured into the second round of UID verification exercise after UID details of more than five lakh students were identified as wrong or missing. School authorities who offer state syllabus are supposed to share details of student UIDs with the government using a web portal hosted by the education department.

As against the questionable details of over five lakh students received on the web portal at the start of the 2019-20 academic year, the second-round stock-taking exercise has identified the details of as many as 2,51, 544 students as unavailable or incorrect. This, however, shows that 2.28 lakh students whose UID credential were under a cloud have come clean.

Following the mismatch in student strength, the government had given school authorities more time to correct the UID details and had warned of strict action against those who fail to do so.

The government claims a huge spike in the number of students joining government and aided schools in the state in recent years as a result of the public education rejuvenation mission. Without touching upon the fudging of student strength, identified after two verification drives, finance minister T M Thomas Isaac, in his budget, proposed measures to stop the practice of aided school managements making teacher appointments by bending rules which are directly linked with the number of students in each class.

In its report submitted to director of general education on January 25, 2020, Kerala Infrastructure and Technology for Education, the government agency entrusted with the task of UID verification, said schools have not even filled up the UID column against more than 1,13,537 students. Since the central and state agencies claim almost 100% UID enrolment in Kerala, the government should take seriously the claims about so many students having no UID at all.

Close to 50,000 UID details shared with the government through Sampoorna portal don’t even match with the UID format. KITE report said such mistakes, despite schools given an additional chance to correct the UID details, call for urgent attention.

More than 90 lakh UIDs uploaded in the Sampoorna portal did not match the UID database. This could happen in the case of even minute difference in the details such as name, birth date and gender of the students in school records and UID.

Meanwhile, reports say glaring mismatch has been identified in the number of students registered with the state Pareeksha Bhavan for the 2019-2020 SSLC examination as against the student details schools had shared with the government at the beginning of the academic year. Since the mismatch continues in glaring proportions, the government would have to carry out manual verification in each school to find out the real strength of students.

Title: MP to withdraw exemption on helmets for women two-wheeler riders
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Bhopal: Madhya Pradesh government would withdraw the exemption granted to women and children riding two-wheelers from wearing helmets. This was stated by deputy advocate general, Praveen Dubey before the division bench of M P High Court headed by the Chief Justice AK Mittal during hearing of a PIL challenging the exemptions extended by the government.

The state government amending the MP Motor Vehicles’ Act, had exempted women from wearing helmets while riding a two-wheeler. A student of National Law Institute University (NLIU), Himanshu Dixit, has filed a PIL challenging the exemptions.

Dubey told the high court that state government would revoke the exemption of compulsory helmet clause for women driving a two-wheeler or women and children below 12 years of age riding pillion.

Following this, the bench comprising chief justice, Justice AK Miital and Justice V K Shukla fixed the case for hearing on March 2, giving two-week time to the state government to do the needful.

Presenting his argument on the plea, Dixit said it was against fundamental right of equality. Besides, it does not do them (women and children) any good and only jeopardize their safety, he said.

In the previous hearing, Dixit had presented fatal road accidents involving women before the judges following which the court issued notices to the state government and other respondents seeking their response on the issue.

Title: Uber driver reinstated, told to drop passenger first before alerting cops
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Mumbai/Bengaluru: Suspended Uber driver-partner Rohit Singh Gaur, who took a poet to Santacruz police station on February 5 suspecting him to be a “communist and a danger to the country”, was reinstated on Tuesday and warned by the aggregator that in future, he should first drop a passenger at the destination before alerting police.

Gaur underwent a refresher course at the Uber office in Mumbai before his suspension was revoked.

“I am disappointed by the Uber advice and have decided to follow my judgment, continue to remain alert and do what needs to be done as an alert citizen,” Gaur told TOI. He began plying cabs from Tuesday night. “Uber officials told me to ensure that every trip should be completed. While this sounds good from business point of view, what about national security and the whole idea of alert citizens helping cops?” he said.

An Uber source said safety of riders is the top priority, and passengers’ complete details could be provided to cops after a passenger is dropped. "If a similar incident recurs, there is a risk of riders lodging a case of abduction if forcibly taken to a police stations,” the source said.

The 23-year-old poet Bappadittya Sarkar said, “I don’t have anything personal against the driver , which is why I did not press charges against him. I did not want him to lose his job. My only problem was my personal safety was threatened. What if tomorrow this happens to a girl?”

Gaur said he was law abiding and would always ensure the safety of passengers.

A statement from Uber on Tuesday said, “High-quality service is something we strive for every day. Following our internal review and to meet our standards, we enrolled the driver for re-sensitisation of our policies and community guidelines."

Sources said during the refresher course, the driver was informed about the things to follow and avoid, Last Saturday, Gaur was felicitated by BJP MLA Mangal Prabhat Lodha in Mumbai for being an “alert citizen”.

Sanjay Hegde, a Supreme Court lawyer, said, “Uber refusing to take action means it endorses its driver’s behaviour.” On February 5, Gaur had taken the Jaipur poet to a police station after overhearing his participation in CAA protests. The driver allegedly told him to be grateful he was not taken “anywhere else”.

Title: SP admits to lapses in probe into Walayar deaths
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Thrissur: Palakkad district police chief G Siva Vikram has agreed to police lapses in probing the rape and death case of the two sisters in Walayar near Palakkad. The P K Haneefa judicial commission recorded the statement of the district police chief on Monday.

“The district police chief gave statement stating that serious lapses were found on the part of the sub-inspector who was the first to probe the case,” Justice Haneefa said.

“The SP also said that the failure of prosecution led to the failure of the case. He also said that there were no lapses found in the second probe commission in the case,” said Haneefa.

“The next sitting of the commission will be held on February 12 and 15 in Thiruvananthapuram and Palakkad, respectively. We will record the statements of the parents on February 15 at Palakkad,” said Haneefa.

Three days ago, the commission collected statements from special public prosecutor Latha Jayaraj, who was under fire for alleged inefficient handling of the Walayar case.

On November 21, the state government appointed the P K Haneefa judicial commission to probe the case. The minor dalit sisters were found hanging in their house in Walayar in 2017.

The commission will submit its report within three months.

Title: 10-yr-old dies after rope gets tangled around neck
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Vijayawada: Tragedy struck a family on Sunday when their 10-year-old daughter died in a freak accident while swinging on a rope at Mutyalampadu village of Dachepalle mandal in Guntur district.

The deceased, Mudhavat Siri (10), was a Class V student at a government school.

According to Dachepalle police officers, the incident took place in the evening when Siri was playing in the backyard of her house.

Police personnel said the girl was swinging on a piece of bamboo tied to a rope when she slipped, the rope got tangled around her neck and asphyxiated her.

Locals who noticed Siri hanging motionless from the rope alerted her father Mudhavat Badun Nayak and his wife Kamalabai who rushed and brought her down from the rope. However, she had died by then. Upon information, cops reached the spot and examined the scene.

They then took her to a local government hospital for post-mortem. Nayak and Kamalabai residents of Mutyalampadu are into agriculture. They have five daughters and Siri was the youngest.

Their eldest daughter got married recently while the second daughter has been working along with her parents. The remaining two children are studying in the same government school as Siri was.

Title: Rane denies rumours of ditching govt
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Calangute: Health minister Vishwajit Rane on Monday said he has no plans to start a new political party or destabilise the government as is being rumoured. “I want the chief minister to know that I am not going to run away from this government. I am going to stay with BJP and will continue with it for the next assembly election and we will form the next government,” he said at Candolim in the presence of chief minister Pramod Sawant.

Speculations arose in political circles after the Sattari Yuva Morcha, backed by Rane, figured in the list of political parties registered with the Election Commission. It was registered in 2016.

Sawant said some politicians were trying to create confusion. “There are some who have nothing to talk about and have become insecure because they’re not part of the government. This government has been working to improve and complete numerous projects,” he said, citing the completion of the Canacona Manohar Parrikar bypass road among other works. tnn

Title: Division-wise voters’ lists put on display
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Vijayawada: Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) on Monday readied the final list of voters in the 64 election divisions for the coming municipal elections. Division-wise voter lists were displayed at ward secretariats and municipal offices across the city.

Authorities of town planning, estate and community development wings of VMC did a detailed exercise on finalising voters’ lists.

The civic body utilised the final voters’ lists of 2019 general elections for preparing the division-wise lists.

Officials said around 8 lakh voters were identified in the preliminary voters’ lists which would be displayed at offices. People can raise objections on voter lists before publishing the final lists of voters. Major political parties were busy verifying ward-wise voters’ lists.

The civic authority has decided to conduct elections in 808 polling stations across the city. Vijayawada Municipal Corporation officials had already increased the number of electoral wards in the city from 59 in 2014 to 64 in 2020.

Title: Coronavirus in Kozhikode: One admitted to isolation ward of Kozhikode hospital
Content:
Representative image

KOZHIKODE: One person who arrived from a coronavirus-hit country was admitted to Kozhikode Beach Government General Hospital isolation ward with mild fever on Monday. The hospital authorities also discharged a person who was under observation on the day. In total, three people are kept under observation in the hospital isolation ward.According to health officials, as many as 396 people who have arrived in the district from coronavirus-hit countries till Monday remain under the surveillance of the health department. This includes the seven people who arrived on Monday. Of the 396, 393 are quarantined at home by the department.District medical officer Dr V Jayashree informed that the health department has send the two swab samples collected from the persons on Monday to the NIV lab at Alappuzha. “We have sent a total of 26 swab samples from Kozhikode so far and 21 of them have tested negative for coronavirus ,” the DMO said.The district health department has imparted counselling to one person who is under home isolation to ease tension. A team of 30 social counsellors has been formed in the district and they have provided counselling to around 100 people kept under home quarantine in the district so far. They have been providing counselling over phone to the needy persons to boost their morale and to clear their doubts about coronavirus and to ensure that they follow the guidelines issued by the health department.The health department has also uploaded short videos on coronavirus on social media and forwarded them to WhatsApp groups to create public awareness.

Title: Teacher sacked after abuse plaints
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Vijayawada: A private school teacher was sacked by the school management on Monday for misbehaving with students during a trip to Kondaveedu fort.

The teacher was identified as Jargumalli Venkateswara Rao who also works as a village volunteer.

According to sources, Rao is a teacher at a private school in Pamidipadu village. During the weekend, the students were taken to a field trip to Kondaveedu Fort where Rao allegedly misbehaved with girl students. Sources said he sought sexual favours from some of the students and used sexually explicit abuses against some of them.

The students then informed their parents about the teacher’s antics. A few parents wrote to the school headmaster about their wards’ ordeal and the school management dismissed Rao based on a internal inquiry report.

The city has seen a rise in crimes against women and children in the recent past. Though authorities have introduced a slew of measures for their safety, a lot more needs to be done.

Title: Kotappakonda ecological park all set for a makeover
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Guntur: The Forest department has decided to revamp the ecological park in Kotappakonda, the abode of the famous Shiva Temple near Narasaraopet. The department is planning to complete a few of the works before Maha Shivarathri. District forest officer (DFO) N Ramachandra Rao visited the ecological park atop Kotappakonda and reviewed ongoing works with officials.

He directed officials to set the focus on providing amenities to pilgrims coming for Maha Shivarathri. “We are completing maintenance works on a war footing as the festival is fast approaching,” the DFO told TOI.

He said they were planning to construct a nature walk facility, souvenier shop and Mokka Prasadam on Kotappakonda before the festival. He said that the department would offer different medicinal plants to the pilgrms as mokka prasadam to encourage them to grow plants after returning home. He said the nature walk track would also create awareness among pilgrims about the importance of growing plants, particularly medicinal plants. “It is expected that 4-5 lakh pilgrims will visit Kotappakonda during the two-day long Maha Shivarathri festivities. It will be a big occasion for the department to create awareness among such a big crowd at a single destination,” said Ramachandra Rao.

He said they were also contemplating to set up terracota artefacts and utensils at Kotappakonda, Uppalapadu and Perecherla Nagaravaan to attract more tourists and pilgrims. He said the artefacts museum would become a big attraction as it would draw tourists from different parts of the country. He said they would provide employment to artisans. “We will ready a comprehensive blue-print for taking up developmental works on Kotappakonda shortly,” said Ramachandra Rao.

He explained that they were also planning to take up a slew of works on Kondaveedu fort for the facility of the tourists.

Title: Muslim shift to AAP complete
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

New Delhi: Delhi’s Muslims have traditionally voted for Congress but shifted allegiance to the fledgling AAP in 2013 . The support, which became more pronounced in 2015, appears to have become absolute now. On Tuesday, as results of the 2020 Delhi Assembly elections were announced, this was most glaringly evident at Okhla .

AAP’s Amanatullah Khan, who received more than 1.3 lakh votes, defeated BJP’s Braham Singh by a margin of 71,827 votes, one of the biggest in this election. In the 2015 Delhi Assembly elections, Khan had defeated Singh by a margin of 64,532. While the margin by which Khan had won last time was also huge, the biggest difference has been in the fortunes of Congress.

In 2015, Asif Mohd Khan of Congress had garnered 20,135 votes but this time three-time Congress MLA Parvez Hashmi got just 5,107 votes. In the Muslim-dominated Okhla constituency, Khan got 66% vote share, while the once popular Congress got just 2.5%!

Okhla is important as Shaheen Bagh, epicentre of the protests against the anti-Citizenship Amendment Act, is part of the constituency. While AAP focused on the development plank, Shaheen Bagh was used as a polarising poll plank by BJP across the city. AAP didn’t take a clear stand on the anti-CAA protests and kept a safe distance from Shaheen Bagh while Congress was vocal against CAA and NRC. In its manifesto, Congress had promised to pass a resolution in Delhi Assembly against CAA and ask the central government to withdraw it. It had also promised that if it came to power, it would not implement NRC and will not implement NPR in its current form. But the community didn’t see it as capable of keeping BJP at bay.

“AAP did not take a stand on Shaheen Bagh, which was very disappointing, but this was very carefully calibrated and Muslims still voted for them,” pointed out Neera Chandhoke, former professor of political science at Delhi University. “This was because Congress was just not mounting its campaign and the party was visible only in the last few days before polling. It is a party without direction with wrong people at the top and voters do judge the efficacy of people at the top,” said Chandhoke.

AAP performed very well in other Muslim-dominated constituencies of the city too. At Seelampur, which too has been witnessing anti-CAA protests, AAP’s Abdul Rehman defeated BJP’s Kaushal Kumar Mishra by 36,992 votes and Congress stalwart Chaudhary Mateen Ahmed came a close third. At Ballimaran, AAP’s Imran Hussain won by a margin of 36,178 votes, while Congress bigwig Haroon Yusuf could garner only 4,797 votes. At Matial Mahal, AAP’s Shoaib Iqbal won by a margin of 50,226 votes, while Congress candidate Mirza Javed Ali received only 3,403 votes.

“It is wrong to think the minority votes in a bloc...However, the community is not economically well off. Kejriwal has helped them,” said Ravi Ranjan, assistant professor, Zakir Hussan Delhi College, Delhi University.

Title: Bhopal Metro Hits Fund Hurdle, Agency Seeks European Bank Aid
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Bhopal: MP urban development and housing administration minister Jaivardhan Singh has directed officials to prepare a roadmap of urban bodies’ development works. He reviewed the departmental schemes here on Monday.

Awaiting the appointment of a full-time managing director, the Madhya Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MPMPCL) is expected to seek mobilisation advance of Rs 1,000 crore to avoid delays in implementation of the Bhopal Metro rail project, according to sources.

MPMRCL has requested financing from European Investment Bank (EIB) for two Metro corridors. These two corridors consist of both elevated and underground sections. The cumulative length of two Metro corridors is 27.87 km. The elevated stretch is 25.46 km and underground is 1.79 km, which includes a ramp length of 620 m. The alignments have 28 elevated stations and two underground stations.

According to cost estimates calculated at 2009 rates, construction cost for Phase I of the Metro network will be about Rs 5,640 crore. The Bhopal Metro network consists of six lines to be implemented in different phases. While Karond Square to AIIMS (Purple Line) will be constructed in the first phase, the network from Bhadbhada Square to Ratnagiri Tiraha (Red Line) is planned in the later stages. The Karond Circle – AIIMS (Purple Line) Metro line runs in north-south direction and is 14.99 km in length. It starts at Karond Circle and follows Berasiya Road, GPO Road, Railway Station, Pool Patra Road, Jinsi Road, HBJ Station; and Alkapuri Road to the terminal at AIIMS.

There are a total 16 stations along Purple Line, of which 14 are elevated and two are underground stations. The route length from Bhadbhada Square to Ratnagiri Tiraha (Red Line) is 12.88 km and runs in west-east direction. It starts at Bhadbhada Square and follows Bhadbhada Road, Jahangirabad Road, Chicklod Road, Bogda Pul Road and Raisen Road to the terminal Ratnagiri Tiraha. There are 14 stations along Red Line. The Roshanpura square station is the crossing station to Line 1 and 4 and Pul Bogda station to Purple Line and 3.

Title: Sixth chargesheet filed against Jolly
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Kozhikode: The special investigation team (SIT) probing the Koodathayi multiple murder case, filed a chargesheet in the sixth and final case on Monday. The SIT filed the chargesheet in the murder of Annamma Thomas , wife of Ponnamattam Tom Thomas, before the Thamarassery magistrate court naming Jolly Joseph as the accused in the case.

Jolly murdered Annamma by mixing ‘Dog Kill’, a poison to kill dogs, in mutton soup, said K G Simon, Kozhikode Rural district police chief. According to police, except Annamma, the five other victims were killed using cyanide. The chargesheet has 1,061 pages and contains 79 documents to prove Jolly’s involvement in the murder. This is the only case in which Jolly is the lone accused. Two others who provided cyanide to Jolly are the accused in other five cases.

Annamma was murdered on August 22, 2002. The poison was mixed in the soup a day before it was served to avoid foul smell and bad taste, police said. “She decided to serve the poison-laced soup as Annamma had the habit of having mutton soup every day,” Simon said.

Police also claimed to have recovered the prescription collected by Jolly from Kozhikode veterinary hospital to purchase dog kill. The prescription is one of the major documents presented by the police in the chargesheet.

Annamma was the mother of Roy Thomas, Jolly’s first husband. “It was Annamma’s persistence to send Jolly for work that forced her to commit the murder,” Simon said. Jolly had completed only pre-degree. But she lied to Roy’s family that she was a post graduate.

According to the chargesheet, Jolly was afraid that she would be caught red handed if she wass forced to go for work. “Besides, she was hopeful of gaining control over the Ponnamattam family by murdering Annamma,” Simon said.

The case was probed by a team led by K K Biju, inspector of Perambra.

Title: ‘Murdered Gurugram BJP neta faced domestic violence’
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Munesh Godara

GURUGRAM: Haryana BJP Kisan Morcha leader Munesh Godara, who was allegedly shot dead on Saturday night by her husband Sunil — a private security officer and a former Armyman — had suffered domestic violence and abuse for several years, her family alleged on Monday.

Sunil Jhakkar, brother of 35-year-old Munesh, told TOI that after Munesh wed Sunil Godara at the age of 15, she never managed to lead a ‘normal married life’ as her husband often used to beat her.

In 2013, Jhakkar added, Munesh had tried to kill herself by consuming poison after she was thrashed and locked inside the house by Sunil. This was the same year Munesh was appointed as the BJP Mahila Morcha chief in Haryana, a post she held till 2016. “We filed complaints against Sunil at least 15 times for domestic violence,” said Jhakkar.

Sunil Godara’s father Dalip Singh, who was the original complainant in the case, had accused his son, along with two others, Bunty Gujjar and his Anu, of murder. Singh had told police that the couple often had arguments because Sunil suspected Munesh had an affair with Gujjar.

On Monday, Jhakkar submitted a complaint to the police commissioner accusing Sunil and Dalip Singh of conspiracy for murder. Jhakkar, who was accompanied by Gujjar, dismissed all allegations against the latter, saying, “Claims of my sister having an affair are rumours.”

According to his complaint, “Sunil Godara and his father had made a plan to kill my sister. He had been beating her ever since they got married.” He also alleged that the father-son duo had been eyeing the property that was in Munesh’s name.

Jhakkar said on Saturday, he dropped his sister to her Spaze Privy house in Sector 93 around 9:20 pm. “My younger sister Manisha was speaking to Munesh on the phone when she heard her saying that she has been shot,” he said.

At the time of the incident, Munesh had been working in the kitchen. The couple’s children — a son and a daughter — were also present in the house. Dalip had said in his complaint that after their argument escalated, Sunil took out his revolver and shot Munesh.

Sources said Sunil had then put the gun to his head, but was stopped by his son. He fled thereafter. Police, which formed teams for the investigation, are trying to locate him, said ACP Prit Pal.

Sunil was earlier employed with the Army and had been forced to take voluntary retirement due to his conduct.

Title: Now, a lab to detect ‘animal fat’, detergents in food, milk
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Health minister Tulsi Silawat inaugurated the lab in Bhopal on Monday

Bhopal: Answering to sensitivities of millions, Madhya Pradesh Food and Drugs Administration (FDA) has been equipped with a microbiology laboratory, that can detect animal fats or ‘pashu charbi’ in food as well as milk products.

The new lab worth Rs 17 crore was inaugurated by health minister, Tulsi Silawat, in Bhopal on Monday.

It is the first microbiological laboratory of the state at the FDA office at Idgah Hills in Bhopal. “Things are going to change now . Those involved in food adulteration will not go scot-free,” said Silawat.

Until now, state FDA could only conduct simple chemical tests, like level of content of nutrients in food. With microbiological tests, the lab technicians will be able to conduct detailed tests. “Animal fat can now be detected. Contaminants that can cause food poisoning can also be identified in the new lab,” said MPFDA nodal officer, Arvind Kumar Pathrol.

Presence of pesticide including urea, detergents, heavy metals added in food can also be diagnosed, in the high tech lab. Initially four machines, each costing about Rs 4 crore each has been installed. Equipment worth Rs 80 lakh is expected to installed in the Idgah Hills lab, in the next few days. As per an MoU signed with the FSSAI, the expert team that will be responsible for operation and maintenance of the lab will be supported by FSSAI. It will be for three years after which FDA personnel will be trained for a takeover.

Title: Coronavirus Kerala: All 14 samples test negative in Palakkad
Content:
Representative image

PALAKKAD: Considerable relief for health department officials and the people in the district as all 14 samples sent to National Institute of Virology for novel coronavirus tests were found negative.The health bulletin issued by the district medical officer Dr K P Reetha here on Monday said that 127 people are currently under observation of which one is admitted in the hospital in the district.A total of 162 persons were under observation and 35 persons had completed the observation period in the district, the medical bulletin said. It said that school teachers were given training and awareness campaign was launched in schools, anganwadis and neighbourhood groups on coronavirus.The DMO said that those who are returning from the virus-affected areas should confine themselves to their houses for 28 days and should not visit public places even if virus symptoms are found on them.Father, son arrested for spreading fake news Thrissur: The medical board, on Monday, discharged three people under surveillance at the Thrissur Medical College Hospital, Kodungallur taluk hospital and a private hospital, following improvement in their condition, said district collector S Shanavaz.As per the latest data, 234 people are under home quarantine in the district. On Monday, officials sent three samples to test for the infection, taking the total number of samples sent to 86. The condition of the infected girl continues to be stable.A father and son have been arrested for spreading fake news about the virus infection. Arakkaparampil Veetil Venugopal, 53, son Akhil Venugopal were arrested from Aengandiyoor, near Thrissur. A total of 14 people have been arrested for spreading fake news and creating fear among people.

Title: Power tariff up by Rs 0.95 a unit after first 500, commoners spared hike
Content:
This story is from February 11, 2020

Amaravati: Sparing commoners, Andhra Pradesh Electricity Regulatory Commission (APERC) has increased power tariff for high-end consumers in the state. APERC chairman justice CV Nagarjuna Reddy released the retail supply tariff order at a media conference on Monday.

According to the new tariff, consumers using more than 500 units per month are required to take an additional burden of Rs 0.90 per unit. The tariff for 500-plus-units consumers has been fixed at Rs 9.95 per unit. It was Rs 9.05 per unit in the previous tariff order. APERC chairman said his team had carefully studied the proposals of AP Southern Power Distribution Company Limited and AP Eastern Distribution Company Limited and went through objections filed by the general public before proposing the new tariff.

Justice Reddy said about 1.35 lakh domestic and industrial consumers would have to pay additional charges due to the increased tariff. He added that they had taken every care to avoid burdening the poor and commoners, and so have proposed the hike only for those consuming more than 500 units per month. He pointed out that both discoms would require Rs 44,840.97 crore for the purchase and transmission of power during the coming fiscal while their revenues stand at Rs 30491.90 crore, leaving a deficit of Rs 14,349.07 crore. He explained that increased tariff would reduce the burden to the tune of Rs 1,394.97 crore. The commission had determined the revenue gap of both the discoms to be Rs 10,060.63 crore after taking purchase and sale values into account.

He said the commission had reduced the gap by Rs 2,893 crore after making a detailed study of the proposals filed by the discoms.

He said the commission had agreed to the state government’s offer of paying Rs 8,353.58 crore to meet the subsidy costs for supplying 9 hours of free power to the agriculture sector. He said they have readied a fool-proof action plan for interruption-free supply to agriculture pump sets.

He said the government subsidy amount was increased due to the increase in the supply hours and they have directed discoms to find-out ways to reduce the burden on the government without levying burden on farmers. Interestingly, the commission had turned down the discoms’ proposal to increase tariff for the railways and directed to supply power at the present rate of Rs 5.50 per unit.

The commission took the decision after taking the objections filed by SCR into consideration.
